Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: christopherjrost
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at La Villa Maillot almost a month back and I must say, I had an incredible experience. I was staying at a much larger branded hotel prior to checking in at La Villa Maillot and while it was a fine hotel, my experience there did not even come close to my experience at La Villa Maillot. The huge difference maker was the staff at La Villa Maillot. From checking in, to room service, to housekeeping, to the bartender to checking out, I was greeted with a cheerful, friendly and helpful staff. I recommend anyone traveling through Paris to check this property out because I guarantee you will not be disappointed if you do.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed in the new room....”
Reviews.Author: LovesHolidaysAlways
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying in the room they are testing as the model for their upcoming renovations....very comfortable, modern....and oh....what a nice bathroom....love the lighting as well.... As I saw another guest previously mentioned, the staff is excellent....they are all very helpful and will go out of their way to address any concerns you may have.... Oh...and you can trust their recommendations...they had recommended a restaurant next to them (Villa Corse) next to them that had not inspired me from the outside (perhaps the weather strips as it was cold)....but was very nicely surprised on the last night when I entered....nice ambiance, etc....regretting doubting the suggestion... ;)

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: jnha
Reviews.Content: A small hotel near Porte Maillot in Paris Western area. Very friendly and efficient staff. The beds are excellent and the room I had offered plenty of space, specially for a Paris hotel. Bathroom well equipped and practial to use. Wonderful breakfast served at lobby level, with a huge choice of options. Definitely recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ingrid S
Reviews.Content: Extremely good service and helpful staff! Had a room facing the backyard which was very quiet. Good sized room for Paris with comfortable bed. Free internet. Very clean and neat. Marble bathroom with bath tub, bathrobe, slippers. Very close to Porte Maillot Metro station which is on the main tourist line making it very easy and convenient. Had breakfast there twice - great atmosphere, not the biggest selection - but what they offered was great, great coffee. No complaints whatsoever! Will go back in a heartbeat and will help family members book with this hotel as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: fkaCraig
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. The location is great and the staff are excellent. The breakfast is lovely but could do with more choice. What was there was absolutely great. Rooms were well cleaned and well appointed. Spa is lovely, missing a pool but the sauna and steam room were brilliant. Very quiet too. No complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay again”
Reviews.Author: Rooftop_living
Reviews.Content: Good points: Very helpful and friendly staff especially Patrick. Nice bathroom and comfy bed Great spa (was open from 5-9 each evening and free for residents) opposite a city carefour shop (a bit like tesco metro) good location Less good points: slightly small room but don't let that put you off

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Alice Y
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for a week at La Villa Maillot in June 2011. We found this boutique hotel to be charming, spacious, comfortable, and loved the art deco lobby/dining area. Our stay included the buffet breakfast, with all you can drink coffee/juices, and was quite simple and delicious. The room was spacious, had luxury spa toiletries (including a shoe shine sponge, which was very useful after walking around all day), and free internet service. (Much appreciated!) The receptionist was nice and was able to provide us directions to our destinations. The location was extremely convenient, being located a couple blocks from the subway station. From the Roissy-Charles de Gaulle airport, we took the Air France bus directly to Porte Maillot, for approximately 15 euros/pp one way. We then just walked a few blocks to the hotel. My only negative comment, is that they need to update their computer system/get the quirks worked out. When we first checked in, I inquired in regards to the breakfast buffet included with our stay, and at first the receptionist said that she did not see it included. So, I had to show her my receipt, and then it was sorted out. Also on checkout, there was a phone charge from our hotel room, and when we told the receptionist that we did not make any phone calls. He told us that it was automated, so we must have made the call. I refused to pay the extra charge (based on principal) and was never bothered by the charge again. Overall, a very comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “A true touch of French Class”
Reviews.Author: JAGUAR33Bordeaux
Reviews.Content: If you have to attend an exhibition or a show to the Palais des CongrÃ¨s at Porte Maillot and if you're fed up with palace hotels like Concorde Lafayette & Le Meridien, you should try the cosy Villa Maillot ! Brand new king room or junior suite for nearly the same price and no waiting lane but a VIP dedicated attention and availability to the guests, less noise and crowdy lobby, several top restaurants at less than half a mile. Try it, you should come back !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend”
Reviews.Author: mickeyb186338
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent , well placed for all modes of transport and walkable to Champs Elysees. Breakfast wall all you could need. The staff and in particular Patrick on reception were very helpful and friendly. Will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel, lovely room”
Reviews.Author: MrM1981
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a recent business trip and found it very pleasant indeed and the staff were very friendly, professional and attentive. My room was very comfortable and quite spacious and I was not aware of any outside noise from the busy street. I would certainly consider staying here again in future .

Reviews.Title: “beautiful boutique hotel in paris”
Reviews.Author: darceyNl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this beautiful boutique hotel in september. Excellent location ,close to the champ lysses, easily walk to arc de triumph. Welcoming and friendly front desk staff. Rooms were spotless and tastefully decorated,.extras such as bathrobes and slippers were lovely. Convenient free wifi in our room as well. Definitely would stay here again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - would recommend it to anyone!”
Reviews.Author: PSA30
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights and wanted to congratulate the hotel on providing such a firendly, efficient and personal service. The location is perfect - close to everything, but not in a noisey location. The staff are all very friendly and very helpful - nothing was too much trouble. The rooms are spotless, the beds very comfortable and the facilities just right. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and will certainly return next time we visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: Anne C
Reviews.Content: Our two families (4 adults and 5 children) are staying here for a week. We are still at the hotel and having such a good experience I wanted to post this now. The hotel is lovely - a charming blend of Parsian style and modern comforts. The rooms are well-appointed and very clean and a good size. The bed linens are particularly comfortable. The bathrooms are also very nice. The location is good - easy access to the Metro at Port Maillot which is served by several lines makes accessing the major tourist destinations quite easy. Depending on your stamina you can also walk to some of the sights, although this was a bit far for some in our party..there are restaurants in the vicinity, as well. The staff has been amazing. Very welcoming and hospitable, from the moment we arrived when we were met on the sidewalk and assisted with our luggage into the hotel. We had a minor problem concerning one of the rooms ( which was no ones fault but a problem none the less) and Hamonie and Daniel bent over backwards to offer a solution that was even better than the original plan.

Reviews.Title: “3rd time lucky”
Reviews.Author: ToineLondon
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Great Hotel of the World for 8 nights from 26th June to 4th July, having read all the positive reviews. We also emailed the hotel, both in French and English, to request a light and quiet room. The hotel emailed us back to acknowledge our request. However, things didn't quite go as well as we'd expected. To start with, there was no warm welcome upon check-in from either the doorman, who ignored us completely, or the young man in reception, who was rather rude and took quite a while to find a room for us (despite our booking well ahead of time). The room we were offered was on the 1st floor was exceptionally dark and depressing, with only half-windows with no view at the top. If one bent down then one could have a view of a constant flow of traffic on the busy avenue. After about an hour in this 'cell', we realized that we could not possibly stay there for 8 nights, and asked if we could have another room. The young and unhelpful man told us that the hotel was fully booked. We were deeply dissatisfied by the whole experience and were feeling very stressed at this point. Fortunately, later on that Sunday evening, the young man was replaced by a much more friendly man, who moved us to another room right on the 5th floor with much more light and a view of the avenue. Although the issue with light was resolved, there was now a problem with noise. Avenue de Malakoff, like other avenues in Paris, are flooded with traffic and the noise can be extremely bad. After staying in this 2nd room for 1 night, we decided to complain formally to the hotel manager the following morning. This resulted in us being shown a room on the 6th floor, which overlooked the back of the hotel. The previous client had just left and we had to wait a while for it to be cleaned. A much more friendly doorman/porter came to help us transfer our luggage to this room. At last, our initial request was granted. The 3rd room was both light and quiet, and we stayed there for the remaining 7 nights. Not sure if we'd like to renew our experience at La Villa Maillot next time we are in Paris. So, perhaps, merci et adieu.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible bed and expensive WiFi”
Reviews.Author: Mckiwis
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night and couldn't get decent/any sleep because the bed was just awful , it was so old and soft that I kept getting rolled in towards the center of the bed (not nice when two people are sharing an old bed) - they even had stuffed the bed with extra cushioning under the sheets to cover that problem but it made no difference. Our room smelt musty and had a large stain on the wall paper. All the furniture was so old and dated (including the bathroom). There was a giant chair sitting on the side of our bed that stopped us from being able to walk to that side to get into bed. Who does that? so silly. No free WiFi still, even 3 star hotels we stayed in provided that. We were so lucky that we could login to a service in that area provided by Orange for free. The pamphlet in the hotel says that their staff are at our disposal to help with luggage - our experience was we arrived at night , and had zero help from the person at the desk with our luggage. In fact the guy ran straight back to the front desk as soon as he saw us park our car. Would never pick it again. Awful value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: IDtourist
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel through tripadvisor, so thanks !! We stayed for 2 nights and enjoyed it very much. The location is perfect, we took Air France bus from the airport to the hotel. It involved a little walk but we managed it fine with our suitcases and all. There is a metro station nearby, and the area itself is lovely. There is a small carrefour supermarket right across the street, which was handy to get snacks etc. There are plenty of nice cafes nearby. The staffs were very helpful and friendly, and spoke good English. We enjoyed jogging every morning to Eiffel Tower and along the banks of Seine from the hotel. We also enjoyed the sauna and the steam bath very much. I will definitely stay at La Villa Maillot again next time we're in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “A great Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: 63romain
Reviews.Content: A great and very quiet hotel at walking distance from "Palais des Congres" Porte Maillot and the metro station with very helpful staff. The Spa is a plus, internet access is not free.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy Paris, but...”
Reviews.Author: C-GPWF
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel only one block from La Porte Maillot. It is conveniently located in Rue Malakoff at about 400 meters from the Air France bus stop to the airport (Rossy CDG). It is also only 10 min walk to L'arc de triumph, 5 min to the Palais de Congres and only 25 min to la Tour Eiffel. Beware that just across the bus stop is another hotel with taxis on the door that will charge you 10 Euros for the ride!! Yes, they might take you for an unwanted tour. Better just walk, it is good for your health and your pocket in a very nice and safe neighbourhood. The reception at the hotel by a cute parisienne was professional and warming. They kept our luggage since we arrived around 9:30 AM until the room was ready around 11:30. The double room was small with small and high windows, but clean and well appointed. The bathroom was small, but well prepared with toilet, separated from the shower area. The beds were again small but comfortable. The hotel has a great sauna and spa at no extra charge to decontract after long days walking the city and visiting places. It is open from 5 to 9 PM. We did not try the restaurant or breakfast on premises, we rather got out to eat in the thousands of great small restaurants and patisseries. Three mayor drawbacks in this place; internet is extra at 18 euros per hour! although, I like to go to Paris to visit Paris and not to be in the web, everybody needs to check his/her mails and look for info and at that cost I found it outrageous. Second, one evening we returned to the hotel and the room had been cleaned but possibly by somebody who was a heavy smoker. It stank to cigaret. We had open the window in very cold Paris and request some sort of spray to combat the odour. Third, at 180 euros per night without breakfast (around U$ 265) it is way overpriced. Problem is all hotels are, but the euro financial crisis might bring them to a more reasonable level....soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Price, Great Stay.”
Reviews.Author: kmac783
Reviews.Content: This was a great find, and thanks to Trip Advisor. The room was beautiful, if located on the street (though it was a quiet street and therefore not bad). It was much bigger than we expected, having stayed in Dublin and not realized the European definition of "cozy". This room was fabulous and spacious. Bathroom too was great, you didn't hit your elbows on the sides of the shower. And my six-two husband didn't have to slouch. The bed was very comfy (lots of down bedding - though the hubby prefers firmer). As mentioned in other reviewers comments, the breakfast is expensive and didn't look all that appetizing, and running down the street for coffee and breakfast will work just fine. The concierge was wonderful and the same gentleman was there almost everyday. When we arrived, our room was not ready, but they provided a holding place for our luggage and some much needed coffee for free. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would definitely stay there again. One last comment, the location really is PRIME. - It is just a block and a half from a metro stop that is on a great line - many attractions. - Also when coming in from the airport, there is a bus (14 Euro/person) that will drop you off just 2 blocks away from the hotel, rather than taking a $80 cab ride!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and service”
Reviews.Author: back-to-bach
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay in this area and, while it would not be my first neighborhood choice in Paris, it is extremely convenient to the metro and the CDG bus to the airport. Located just off the fashionable Avenue Foch, the service is excellent, the rooms comfortable (very, for Paris) and breakfast delicious. Patrick and Thierry were at the desk most of our 3 night stay and were wonderfully helpful especially with problems associated with the strike in France during this time. The only negative is lack of WiFi. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Staff in a Safe, Business Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynSailorBoy
Reviews.Content: A small, upscale Parisian hotel with a superb staff available to assist you 24/7. Artistic, immaculate and welcoming. We had a very pleasant four-night's stay. The rooms are typically small but very comfortable. We had a charming view of buildings, trees, ivy and sky. No noise with windows closed. Abis, Daniel, Ellie at the front desk as well as the hotel's bright and personable manager, Thierry Dechaux, all speak English well and are very pleasant and helpful. We opted to eat breakfast out doors at the patisserie on the corner as the hotel's breakfasts were too large and expensive for our taste...still, they looked to be excellent. This turned out to be more of a business district than the touristy Latin Quarter that we're used to. We ate twice at Del Papa's, an Italian restaurant one block away, and loved it both times. Excellent food and service. Only slight negative: You have to stand by the front desk to use their free computer. No privacy or sitting. Bottom line: We highly recommend La Villa Maillot.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: guylux
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Villa Maillot several times in the past 4 years. Great value for price. Location close to Champs Elysees (walking distance) is best. Rooms are good size. In case you have more money to spend, do not hesitate to take one of the suites. Beds are very comfortable. Service very helpful. The only slight problem is the car parking (at least there is one, exception in Paris) which is difficult to acces especially for bigger cars. Nice restaurants close to the hotel. Have recommended this hotel to several friends and customers of mine visiting Paris. Will come back shortly.

Reviews.Title: “NICE, CLEAN AND WELL PLACED.”
Reviews.Author: ALFRED99
Reviews.Content: A small family run Hotel that delivers most of the essentials at a good price. The wife and myself stayed for four nights at the end of April 2010. Located really well near the Palais de Congress a few hundred yards from the Porte Maillot Metro Station. Pleasant enough area but some "down and outs" which the Paris authorities seem to tolerate. We always felt safe though. Good (but pricey) restaurants in the immediate vicinity but we preferred to walk a while and seek out more "local" places where the menus where still varied but more reasonably priced. Also a good way to enjoy the Paris environs. The Hotel has a spa (we did not use) and is clean, friendly and comfortable but do not expect lots of extra facilities as you would in a more upmarket Hotel. Our room on floor 6 was a good size (bigger than a recent London Hotel), kept very clean and pleasant by housekeeping, great shower and tea/coffee making equipment and a mini fridge. Bed was very comfortable. The beverage making was a real plus and the Hotel staff were very happy to provide us with fresh milk. Very handy too is the small but well stocked Supermarket across the road. The double glazing was extremely efficient although the room was hot and the air conditioning (see previous reviews) would not set below 27 degrees. Although not a noisey location an open window at night would have let in too much traffic noise. Small niggles included room safe not working despite efforts of two different staff and still did not work the day we left! Also on the second day our room keys did not work as we had only been booked in for one night! Lovely breakfast area in a garden conservatory and breakfast was plentiful but if you wanted a good big cooked breakfast you might be disappointed. Good variety of different produce but the hot stuff left in tureens did not look appetising. To summarise; great location, really clean and good size room and great bed, fridge plus tea/coffee making items and in our room at the end of a corridor really quiet. If you want top class french cuisine restaurants close by and really great just a short walk to the nearby metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, friendly, cosy hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: anna1880
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned from a 4 night break in Paris staying at the La Villa Malliot. The hotel is small and very friendly. The staff are very helpful and attentive. We like many others got stuck in Paris due to the Eurostar failures, the hotel staff put us at ease, ensuring a room was available for us as we needed to stay another ngiht. They searched the internet for us for other options and tried to get through to Eurostar on the phone for us. All done with a genuine sense of empathy for our misfortune. The room was very clean and well serviced by the housekeeping staff who again were very professionally friendly. Breakfast was simple and functional in a nice conservatory at the back of the hotel. The bar staff were also lovely. Could not recommend this hotel enough for the friendliness and professionalism of the staff, the perfectly warm room after following a cold day of sightseeing and the great location. Very close to the Metro station, maximum 5 minute walk and the close proximity of a Carrefour supermarket perfect for buying drinks and snacks. Although we had a terrible time with Eurostar customer service the fact that we needed to spend an extra night in the hotel made it easier to bare.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great staff, great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: guss45
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week at La Villa Maillot in October 2009 - her first stay here and my second. Started with a nice greeting by a courteous, helpful staff. Our room was comfortable - not huge, but spaceous and comfortable by European standards. The room faced the street, but was quiet when we closed the double paned windows. The amenities were just right - a good selection of tv stations on a flat panel tv, a minifridge, and wireless internet (yes, a bit pricey, but there was a wide range of prepaid wireless times available, so if you just want to download e-mail you can do so economically. And hey, we were here to see Paris, not to surf the net). The hotel is very conveniently located. An easy walk from the Air France airport bus stop at Port Maillot, and in close proximity to the Arch de Triumph and the Champs Elysees. A Carrifour grocery shop directly across the street, and numerous restaurants in the area (try the seafood restaurant at the end of the street). Give this hotel a try - you won't be disappointed. When we return to Paris, we'll return to La Villa Maillot.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kerryntrevor
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights before touring France. It was the only accommodation with tea and coffee making facilities, throughout our trip, which is a huge bonus. The staff were wonderful, very helpful and knowledgeable. Walking distance to many sites, metro and restaurants. There is a supermarket directly across the street. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: 519mcnel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in mid-October with my girlfriend on a short break. I found the hotel to be clean, compact yet well appointed. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and didn't even bat an eyelid at my appalling French. We did not eat at the hotel, and chose to sample some of the many restaurants and brasseries in the area. The choice of cuisine is vast but of course cost can be extremely variable! We walked to many of the popular tourist attractions from the hotel as I feel they are within easy walking distance (although others may differ) and allow you to soak up the wonderful atmosphere and beautiful surroundings. Transport links are excellent - Porte Maillot is 600m walk from the hotel where you can connect easily to the Metro or Bus to the airports. Definitely worth a second look.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good - watch out for the extras though”
Reviews.Author: Kevlondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night due to the 50%+ discount I found on a travel site. Booked a deluxe room for â‚¬180 per night, which sounded reasonable if not exactly cheap. Room was street-facing on the 7th floor, high enough to avoid the worst of the street noise. Room was a typical size for Paris (i.e. small) but big enough for a double bed, easy chair and work desk. Furnishings were adequate if not spectacular. Room was immaculately clean, bed was comfy and the bathrobe and slippers are a nice touch. The problems with this hotel are in the small details. I phoned to request an iron shortly after checking in, and was told I had to travel down to the basement and use the ironing board set up in the massage room. More of an annoyance than a problem I suppose. The WiFi service is eye-wateringly expensive (â‚¬24 for 24 hours) and not especially good - the connection is slow and drops out periodically - I must have logged in 6 or 7 times throughout the evening, and trying to watch video news clips took forever. TV service is equally poor - a limited range of international channels and practically no pay TV to speak of (2 films plus porn), also the TV was maddeningly quiet - even at full blast I couldn't hear some channels while the room window was open. If some hotels can offer 50+ channels, why can't they all?? The breakfast buffet was good, if a little limited in comparison to other hotels I've stayed at. And at â‚¬25, it certainly doesn't represent good value. I understand this is very lucrative for hotels, but this price seems excessive - even if I were staying at the George V or the Ritz, I wouldn't expect to pay more than this. Overall not a bad choice for a short trip - I can live without TV as I had work to do, but if I were staying on a leisure break I wouldn't feel I was getting real value for money with the poor quality of the in-room services and dining.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Great spot.”
Reviews.Author: PTerry
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. Very nice staff. English, German, Spanish speaking staff. Very nice breakfast. Two blocks from the Metro trains. Four blocks from the Congress Center.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in Upscale Convenient Paris Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: imovemtns
Reviews.Content: My husband & I spent our last night in Paris at La Villa Maillot. We have not stayed in this part of Paris before but we would stay here again on our next trip. We moved over from the Westin Paris (5 stars) which was much more expensive and very impersonal. La Villa Maillot staff was very nice, pleasant and helpful, the room was large by Paris standards (larger than our room at the Westin). Across the street is a very nice grocery store and pharmacy, and there are many great restaurants nearby. Also, Paris Metro, RER and SCNF train stations are about 1 block away. The location is not so much in the heart of the tourist scene, which we prefer, but you do have to walk further (or take the train) to get to some of the sites. Our room was at the back of the hotel and was quiet, except from occassional comings and goings of other guests. 2 minor complaints: The mattress could have been more comfortable (a little saggy), and despite the fact that this is supposed to be a non-smoking hotel, it was clear that someone was smoking in the hotel. The cigarette smoke permeated our room through the air conditioning. I recognize that the hotel has no control over guests who choose to flout the rules and smoke in a non-smoking room, but at least spare the rest of us by making adjustments to the ventilation system.

Reviews.Title: “With a bit of care, this place could shine”
Reviews.Author: skwirl
Reviews.Content: Based on TripAdvisor reviews, booked six nights here due to its proximity to Porte Maillot (mÃ©tro, known restaurants). Service is above average; rooms are showing their age at this point. The manager/owner genuinely seems interested in the satisfaction of his guests, so I am cutting him a fair bit of slack with this review. What is quite painful is the internet access: â‚¬39 for three days of spotty connections regardless of where you are in the hotel. It regularly resets itself (i.e. drops the session) with no warning -- quite disruptive. After three days of this (at a steep price), I stated that the service was below my expectations and they could either refund me the â‚¬39 or give me another three days for free (which they did). Other than one day when only a single bath towel was left following a service, most everything else is acceptable (buy why were the elevators not vacuumed at all?) A bit more investment in the wi-fi (a necessity these days, even for leisure) and more attention to details would make this a top destination.

Reviews.Title: “The Gem of Paris !”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Walsh
Reviews.Content: Im fussy when it comes to hotels and locations but this was a true Gem! Great standard of hotel which is not too fussy but quaint and very clean! Location - 3 minute walk from Metro starion 'Porte Maiilot' and a lovely 10 minute walk to Arc de T - 20 min walk to Tower - both walks are lined with great little cafes and places to browse! I felt very safe in this area as i know that some areas are 'dodgy'. Overall - if you want to have a great time in a good location then choose this - go to the Victor Hugo bar for a fantastic and relatively cheap Chateau Briand. Â£ v Euro is killing Paris as its very expensive ... but .... its all expensive! Have a good one !

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrepee
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the maillot, such a lovely hotel and we were pleasantly surprised at our room size. the reception staff were very nice and helpful. We didnt make use of the treatments or sauna as the weather was soo hot all we wanted after a day of sightseeing was a cool shower.We got an incredible deal with Expedia.ie, paid only a fracton of the asked price on other sites. Paris is a beautiful city and the hotels location is so handy for travel on the metro - which are incredibly clean.. Had a wonderful time especially when my boyfriend proposed by the Eifel Tower. I will never forget my first visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very clean, very quiet”
Reviews.Author: DeniseBarrieOntario
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at this lovely hotel the gentlemen working at the Front Desk made us feel welcome and went out of his way to help us in every way. He upgraded our room and treated us to a cafe au lait. The rooms are clean, comfortable, quiet - we heard no sound evening or mornings. We had a coffeemaker in our room and high quality toiletries were provided. Location was very important to us and we were able to walk or take the subway everywhere we wanted to visit. Our stay lasted 4 nights and we would definitely recommend this lovely hotel to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: travelsterNewYork_NY
Reviews.Content: Clean and quiet, this hotel is a great place to get some rest and relaxation after a busy day of sightseeing. The personnel are lovely, there is a free afternoon spa (sauna and steam room - massage is additional) for guests, there are free newspapers in your choice of language, a breakfast buffet, and even two scents of toiletries (rose or verveine) in the room. I had a really delightful four nights at La Villa Maillot after checking out of a regrettable hotel that I found on the Internet. If you want to feel comforted and refreshed, don't hesitate to book a room La Villa Maillot - there are no downsides.

Reviews.Title: “C'est Magnifique”
Reviews.Author: njames99
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic Hotel all around. From the extremely friendly and courteous staff to the sparkling clean rooms the Villa Maillot was a very very pleasant surprise. I'd booked it on Hotels.com based on other's positive feedback and they were bang on. The location may not be central, but the area is very quiet, clean, and full of great restaurants and shops. The Porte Maillot tube station is just down the street affording quick and easy access to anywhere you'd want to go in Paris or beyond, or take a short 10 minute walk down la Grande Armee and your at the Arc du Triomphe. The rooms were very spacious by european standards, and again I can't say enough about the outstanding service from the staff. If your looking for a great meal check out the Villa Corse next door and you won't be disappointed. Would most definately stay at the Villa Maillot again.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely relaxing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Deborah022
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights with my mother ( 75) who has never been to Paris before and this hotel could not have been better for her. The location is great...right near line 1 and the RER; so a short stroll for her to access the rest of Paris. The twin room was very comfortable and we have no complaints about the air conditioning unlike another contributor to this site. We liked the toiletries, bathrobes and slippers and I for one really enjoyed the steam bath and sauna downstairs. Breakfast was great! Everything you could want really and the waitress remembered that we liked strong tea. Indeed all the staff could not have been more helpful. Patrick in particular was so lovely, even stopping the traffic outside so my mother could cross the road to the taxi he had called for us! We discovered on checking out that the late night coffees and the afternoon teas that we had had were complimentary so that was another bonus and the Guardian every day so I could keep up with the Ashes scores! We would also thoroughly recommend the 'Auberge Dab' at the end of the road for a truly delicious dinner. It was packed out with parisians on the night we went and I can see why. A little gem of a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Manoja
Reviews.Content: I couldn't have chosen a better place if I had tried. What a wonderful place. The front of house staff were waiting for us on our arrival. They had upgraded our room and we had a spacious room with lovely bathroom on the 5th floor. The room was modern with satellite TV, a plasma screen and air conditioned. The various extras with the room were of high quality. The staff were very friendly, especially Patrick the concerige, advising us on how to catch trains and places to go for dinner. They also helped with our limo service order when the airlines had failed to notify us of our pickup times. The hotel is close to the Arch de Triomphe, which you can see from the end of the street. It is also close to a Metro station and an RER. There are a number of shops and restaurants around that are excellent and there is a small supermarket across the road. we ate breakfast every morning in a charming little bakery 2 minutes walk away. There is also a spa which is complimentary, but we didn't use. The breakfasts, WiFi and massages were on the expensive side so we didn't use/ buy them. We were also able to pay a half charge to keep the room until evening when our plane left. I could rave about this place for hours. It was wonderful

HotelInfo.Name: La Villa Maillot
HotelInfo.Address: 143 avenue de Malakoff, 75116 Paris, France
